Infected The Insane Man The Broken Machine Seeing your life's work reduced to naught but a broken lottery of failing parts, you allow hopelessness to envelop you, retreating with a torrent of tormented tongues into the inner recesses of your mind.

With the measures taken to prevent to unauthorized entry into your lair, there is simply no chance of anyone finding your catatonic form before it expires.

Dead
On this day, the creature known as %1$s, in tandem with its creator and with nimble fortitude did strike bloody terror into the hearts of %2$s people, whilst through marriage of beauty and guile win the blessings of %3$s (per post-rampage non-partisan polling). On this day, the creature known as %1$s, did attempt with valiance and bravery to carry out its master's bidding. Alas, its charge was cut short by enemies about with slings and arrows shot true.
Can death be sleep, when life is but a dream,
And scenes of bliss pass as a phantom by?
The transient pleasures as a vision seem,
And yet we think the greatest pain's to die.

How strange it is that man on earth should roam, 
And lead a life of woe, but not forsake
His rugged path; nor dare he view alone
His future doom which is but to awake. -John Keats
Gads! Though it harnesses the power of a trillion PowerPoint lasers, the incinerator cannot quite seem to eat through the hodgepodge of metals, fabric, and synthetic skin that constitute this wretched creation. The smoke and smell of charred resins is fast becoming untenable in your precisely ventilated lair, and you must act quickly to remedy this.

You can either seal the incinerator and vent the outputs, which would unleash a very noticeable plume party of toxic vapors into the air, or take care of the problem the old fashion way, with a chainsaw and elbow grease. Vent the incinerator Get your hands dirty You flip a set of switches, sealing the incinerator's titanium doors and fully venting its outward bound exhausts. Though a potentially fatal danger is averted, you can practically feel the prying gaze of the outside world upon you. Not content to advertise your devious machinations to the world, you grab a Ne'er-de-Break chainsaw and proceed to "get hacking," as the kids would say. Manual labor has never been your strong suit, and the task proceeds at a maddeningly difficult pace.

When the failed creation is at last sufficiently sliced into flammable pieces, you are left exhausted and not a little bit unstrung. Alas, with the eyes of the world upon you already, there is precious little further attention that an extra ton of poisonous clouds will invite. This bit of salience is as disquieting as it is dire, and you are none the better for it.
Sanity: Endurance: Wealth: Anonymity:
Generator Scanner
Allow the Strength Infuser to starve. Allow the Dexterity Animator to starve. Allow the Intelligence Designer to starve. Allow the loyalty Inculcator to starve. Allow the Beauty Sculptor to starve. Steel yourself with the resolve of a thousand stags and WILL a saving grace into action.
Upgrade the Strength Infuser. Upgrade the Dexterity Animator Upgrade the Intelligence Designer Upgrade the loyalty Inculcator Upgrade the Beauty Sculptor The very walls quake as %1$s scream painful deaths, %2$s cry with tormented agony, and the blood of purity incarnate is spilt like so much spoiled milk. At last, The %3$s hums brighter and stronger.
Stronger, tougher, more muscular! No longer will your creation be relegated to the weakest of the weak. It will, at the very least, rise above the dregs of the abomination food chain. If being burnt in the sad space between inertia and sentience can teach one anything, it is how to move faster than an uphill rolling sloth. Your creation will be guaranteed a minimum speed and agility. A constant state of rejection has been found, in adolescents, to contribute to an array of maladaptive traits and behaviors, not the least of which is general intelligence. Luckily for you, your abomination-in-training is not an adolescent. It will be assured a base level of emotional stability. One would assume that continuous deaths by countless licks of flame would engender a state of contempt, at best. Fortunately, the laws of causal personality inheritance are the least egregious being broken in this place, and as such your creation can now enjoy a permanent state of not-all-consuming-truculence. Though general beauty is in the eye of the beholder, manufactured beauty is the only horse a savvy gambler puts money on. By the time your abomination goes forth to conquer the world, you hope that it will be so charming that none will notice the hideous assortment of unholy bits that makes up its component parts. At the very least, you can ensure it does not terrify the elderly until it's ready.
Cattle prods, dazzling rhetoric and abject begging, oh my! You are able to persuade the creature to be more receptive to your wishes. Don't sell the farm just yet, Wilbur. You fumble over your arguments, and physical coercion is met with a dead stare. The creature remains unpersuaded. Years of near total isolation and a natural penchant for misanthropy and dour disposition have left you the persuasive skills of a bubonic rat. The creature is not amused, and becomes even more obstinate in reaction to your bumbling oratory attempts. Perhaps talking smack about the creature's mom, as nonsensical and sort of self-deprecating as it is, is not the best course of action. The creature is pushed over the edge and attacks! You bow to humility, choosing the safer course.
As it belts out a tune for the ages, the lovely melodic symphony of your creature's voice is soothing on your frazzled nerves. The creature lets loose with a barrage of cacophonous wails, plaguing your already frazzled nerves. The creature's internal mastery of mysticism has it exude a calming presence, which is passed onto you. The creature doesn't quite "get" the gist of mysticism, and the stressful internal struggle exudes an unnerving energy, which passes on to you. The creature retains a masterful control of its pent up demons, and is stronger than it first appears. The creature retains poor control of its inner demons, and will be prone to wiley, spastic outbursts that hurt its dexterity. The creature has emerged with way more muscle mass than anticipated, and this extra buffness will aid its overall strength. The creature has cultivated all the wrong muscle groups in great disproportion, and these unwieldy appendages will server to hinder its overall dexterity. The creature happily accepts a rusty copper figurine that might be Jesus, and a pile of Steel Reserve bottle caps. It purrs with increased devotion. The creature apparently watched several seasons of Entourage in the metallic womb, and is unhappy about doing your bidding without pay. The creature has an extra bounce in its step that will aid its overall dexterity. The creature is, as the kids say, a spaz. Its uncontrolled bouncy buoyancy will hinder its overall dexterity. Your creature's constant of perusal of high brow literature in the womb has boosted its overall intelligence. Unfortunately, all of the National Enquirer and Weekly World News absorbed in the womb has made your creature quite a bit dumber. The creature is simply glad for the opportunity to be seen, and you can tell it is thankful to you. The creature is vexed that despite the attention it will be getting, the expedition is clearly about you, and it you can tell it resents you for that.
Divert the resources. Let the damage occur. Choose the %1$s. Divert the flow Attempt the patch. Into the fray! Just take your Flintstones vitamins. Make a heroically foolhardy attempt to prevent damage. Sure. What's the harm? Homie don't play that game. Yes, because I am smarter than science. How about not? It must be done. I will fight the urge!
Yes, this will surely help. Not today. What a splendid idea. Seems safer just to take the hit. Sure. Seems foolproof. We will not be doing that. Once more into the breach! Let's sit this one out. Sure. What could go wrong? Just pay the bill. Lips to lungs gets it done. Let them wear themselves out. Slip some cash under the door. Release the bees! Grab it while it's fresh. Momma raised you better than that. Divert the power. No, the risk is too great. Definitely. What could go wrong? You haven't need of such trifles. It would seem rude not to. How about not? Yes, embrace the sound. No. This memory lane is paved with potholes. To arms! What? No, thanks. Yes, sounds lovely. Ha. Hahaha. No. Why, I'd be a fool not to. No, thanks. Sure, dust off the ol' boy. Isn't there a reason it's locked away? Fine, fiend! The bargain is struck! No! Away with you, caricature! Yes, strike the deal! Begone, Mammon! It must be done. Nah. Medicine is just more fake news. Well, okay. No way! Choose the %1$s. Submit. Fight it! No, thanks. If we must. Choose the %1$s. Choose the %1$s. Sure! Nah. Choose the Strength Infuser. Choose the Dexterity Animator. Choose the Intelligence Designer. Choose the Loyalty Inculcator. Choose the Beauty Sculptor. You wind up with a sizable emergency fund, though it is a tiny fraction of what you could get from a rogue dictator were you not so short on time. Risk the %1$s.
Alas, your crusty husk that at the best of times resembles an anemic scarecrow has reached the threshold of no return. With barely the strength to wipe the spittle from your droopy jowls, let alone continue to operate a mechanical sophisticant of this magnitide, it appears all is lost.

But wait! The Auto-Compiler! Oh, dad, you did think of everything. Except for your child's emotional needs, but that is of no importance now. The Auto-Compiler will, at a specified point in time, release your creature into the world without supervision. Quick - before the narcoleptic rash flares up again - pick a day!
Tomorrow! Two days hence! Three, three, three! Why wait for more things to go wrong? Before the warm embrace of nap time sets in, you set the compiler to launch your madness into the world. Not too hot and not too cold. This temporal porridge is just right! Before the warm embrace of nap time sets in, you set the compiler to launch your madness into the world. You aren't a former member of Forbes' 100 Wealthiest Mad Scientists for nothing - you like to get your value's worth from things. Three days it will be! Before the warm embrace of nap time sets in, you set the compiler to launch your madness into the world. As you flit in and out of consciousness, your Auto-Compiler attempts to create another monstrosity. Whatever it is, however, will soon be turned into a smoldering wreck. Not the best design on this thing, huh? Rather wasteful, I would say. Another woozy day, another wasted creature… The day is here! You've managed to prop yourself up against one of your less jagged vertical surfaces, watching with deep trepidation as your Auto-Compiler does its super sophisticated thing.

At last, a final iteration of your creature is formed! This will have to be the one. Fade into you…
Oh, dear. You have reached the point where your insanity is no longer the playful One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest kind, but rather the catching-and-impaling-rodents-together-in-a-bid-to-create-a-super-rodent kind. See the difference?

No longer can you comprehend the complexity of the machine in front of you. Rather, it is a jumble of levels, symbols, and stale meatloaf. It seems much more fun to inject the liquid into yourself, and though this gives your skin a healthy green glow, it does little to advance your understanding of this whole mess.
Sadly, you have made such a ruckus during this whole ordeal that if the word "incognito" had not won you the 4th grade spelling bee, no one would believe you knew its meaning.

With no anonymity left, the brass are knocking down your door. Your options are limited. Perhaps some money slipped under the door would grease a few palms? Sure. What's left to lose? Ah, forget it. What's the point? Yielding to despair, you let fate do its thing.

Your door is blown to bits and lasers point at all your parts. With not even a failed creation to act as leverage, you make for a sorry target indeed, and this particular band of ruffians does not like prisoners. You are dead. You scrounge up as much cash, credit chips and bank numbers as you can while under the literal gun and stuff them through the sealed laboratory equivalent of a mail slot, hoping it does the trick.

After a few moments, your Zoom-O surveillance system shows all the scary people sauntering out, but not before their leader looks into the camera and mouths, "We'll be back." Thanks, Arnie. You've bought yourself another day, tops. You scrounge up as much cash, credit chips and bank numbers as you can while under the literal gun and stuff them through the sealed laboratory equivalent of a mail slot, hoping it does the trick.

Your Zoom-O surveillance system shows the scary people happily stuffing your wealth into their heavily-pocketed military uniforms. Their leader then looks up at the camera, grins a shining set of veneers, and proceeds to flip you off. It appears your bribe has not worked.

Your door is blown to bits and lasers point at all your parts. With not even a failed creation to act as leverage, you make for a sorry target indeed, and this particular band of ruffians does not like prisoners. You are dead.
Unfortunately, you just don't have enough worth taking.

Your door is blown to bits and lasers point at all your parts. With not even a failed creation to act as leverage, you make for a sorry target indeed, and this particular band of ruffians does not like prisoners. You are dead.
Your door is blown to bits and lasers point at all your parts. With not even a failed creation to act as leverage, you make for a sorry target indeed, and this particular band of ruffians does not like prisoners.

You are dead.
With no money to pay for daily essentials, you are forced to pawn off some of your machine's components. Sad.
The day is long, and the night longer still. At last it comes - the moment of illumination! The %1$s on the %2$s %3$s, indicating something is being %4$s. After what feels like an eternity, %5$s can be heard, and the object of creation flickers into sight.
Gadzooks! A %1$s %2$s %3$s from %4$s. Checking the readouts, you are informed the %5$s is %6$s.

The terribly esoteric nature of the beast and the rarity of parts precludes a guaranteed fix, and your options are limited. You may be able to divert enough resources toward repairing the errant system, though that will likely damage the %7$s instead.
A %1$s %2$s %3$s from %4$s. Dear Jobeker! It seems that both the %5$s and %6$s are %7$s. Much like Solomon of old, you must decide who lives and who dies. Normally, it's considered good scientific practice to throw as much power into whatever one is working on without regard to consequence. In this particular case though, it may have backfired.

Abnormal levels of %1$s currents are detected racing down the %2$s. This excessive energy will certainly damage the %3$s if it continues. You could divert the electrical flow into %4$s, though the energy surge will not be subtle and will likely draw attention to your evil doings.
It's feeding time! All of your machine components require a very special diet of plutonium, anthrax, asbestos, and organic non-pasteurized milk. Unfortunately, you forgot to order enough for the whole family. One of your parts will have to go without, and that will not fare well for it. %1$s You've dropped your %2$s pills in the %3$s of the %4$s. Trying to extricate the spiked bottle (why is it spiked?) with the only object immediately available, your %5$s, risks damaging a vital component. But man, you really need those pills. Alas, you have been so distracted by your favorite YouTube clips of half-%1$s super mutants hunting half-%2$s mutants that you've neglected the %3$s!

The emotional trauma of neglect aside, its physical situation is dire. You might be able to avert damage by appropriating some parts from other components, though you know what mother might have said about theft had she not been a kleptomaniac. Walnuts! You've knocked over your rejuvenation juice again! Its sickly viscous texture does wonders for coating your perforated innards, but is less kind to the machinery in front of you. Sensors beep wildly, and it appears that damage to the %1$s is impending. Would you like to try injecting bleach into the affected area? The voices are back. Burning through your mind like field of hippie draft cards, they compel you to act.

Fortunately, much of your electricity grid runs through a local community center, and you could channel some of your machine's power into blowing up the group of %1$s that meet there weekly. That should satisfy the bloodlust, though the diversion of power might damage one of your components.
Force of time, force of wear. Your head splits sideways with sleep and sustenance deprived agony. There is %1$s called %2$s that you learned long ago but never sufficiently practiced. Would you like to try it?
Gads! The %1$s has developed %2$s and is threatening to siphon some of your offshore wealth to pay for its grid therapy! Is this even real life?

As a former psychology major, you may be able to talk some sense into the thing, though your skills are quite rusty. The %1$s is sick and tired of being overworked, unappreciated, and paid in bottle caps. It roars its discontent, shaking your walls and calling no small amount of attention to your evil plans.

You may be able to quiet its demands with empty promises of trinkets and swamp drainage, though the effort may take a lot out of you.
Gadzooks! A %1$s of %2$s has somehow gotten into the %3$s, threatening the %4$s! You may be able to draw them out with your trusty %5$s, though that would risk damaging something else. With all the chaos surrounding your day to day endeavors, you have forgotten to pay your %1$s bill! And by "pay," we mean divert massive, small-country-sustaining funds from offshore corporate dummy accounts.

Your operation requires a very delicately balanced set of books, lest the whole thing risk crashing down. You can attempt to haggle with the mafia middle men who streamline the process, or simply pay an exorbitant late fee. Your %1$s is calling on line %2$s. They are not one to take "no" for an answer, and despite your callous, destructive, downright evil machinations, you always did have a soft spot for family.

The work you are doing at the moment is highly crucial, however, and interrupting it is certain to damage something. You may be able to talk your away into an early release, though with your %3$s that always carries a risk. A rapping at your chamber door! How on Gazorpazorp's scorched earth did anyone find your hidden enclave? Your Zoom-O surveillance unit shows a %1$s of %2$s waiting patiently outside. Tenacious bastards, those ones.

Well, you need them gone one way or the other. Bribes or bees, which will it be? The sleepless nights drag on, and you can feel your body paying the price. An experimental concoction of %1$s straight out of %2$s has recently come to your attention, and while it comes with free home delivery and an anonymity guarantee, it is obscenely expensive. Oh, what to do? A flurry of %1$s %2$s are flying off the %3$s. At this rate, the %4$s will be damaged soon.

You feel as if you could patch up the damage, though it will require a very expensive piece of black market uranium, drone-dropped by Amazon Prime's dark web subsidiary, Amazon Crime.

You may have a credit from the %5$s you returned last month. Anyway, no time to check!
The %1$s that you are tapping is currently supplying you with more power than necessary at the moment. You may be able to repair one of your construction components by diverting some of the power to an insufficiently tested %2$s, if you dare. After another endless expanse of time in a seemingly infinite loop of Sisyphean exertion, you happen to spy %1$s affectionately titled %2$s

Oh, how you long for the days when your hobbies were confined to Facebook wars, small group torture and a good book. Perhaps revisiting the latter would be rejuvenating. Another day, another several million dollars in illegally laundered cash. You are deep in thoughts and prayers, minding your own world-dominating business, when you suddenly feel an unsettling %1$s near your %2$s.

What's that, %3$s? You have created a new %4$s for me to try? Oh, lovely, you shouldn't have! Oh, you would like me to test it right now? An old-timey musical hiss emanates from your %1$s. You do not own or possess %2$s, though this fact disturbs you less than you would expect it to. The sound hearkens back to a long-forgotten %3$s. Memories flood past in an unbridled wash of nostalgia, softening your thick skin and kindling what the kids would call "emotional availability."

For a brief moment, your eyes meet the mutant mess of miscreant monstrosity that oozes in various gel-like states all around you. It is a heartfelt, touching moment, that you may elect to explorer further.
Distress sirens blare like spastic foghorns from all corners of the room as %1$s %2$s out of the %3$s. You try to react, but are too late, and the %4$s is damaged. Your palms are sweaty, your head grows heavy, and mom isn't making anymore spaghetti. Not since the accident. The inhumane, exertive pressures of your burden have notched another victory against your %1$s.
An anguished cry pours forth from the incinerator. Wretched beast - it was supposed to be dead! Burnt! Annihilated!

The screams are inhuman, obviously, both in pitch and volume, and even the triple-insulated nano-plexiglas soundproofing your lair is unable to contains the cacophony of primal suffering. Though it has likely scared any daytime explorers away, the outcry is all the more likely to call attention to you. The fix is in at the %1$s races this week, and that tip you got from %2$s has fallen flat! Who would have thought a champion with the name "%3$s" would turn out to be a total flop? You make a mental note to bet less next time, or possibly just do due diligence. Is not betting an option?
Would you like to fight %1$s for money? Don't think about the logistics too much. Feeling a little tuckered? Would you like to try a new workout based on the science of %1$s? I'm sure your mind can handle it. Feeling a bit kooky? Care to attempt some homespun electroshock therapy? Remember, this is your home, not some kid with a couple of wires. Just because you're paranoid doesn't mean they're not watching you, right? Perhaps it would be a good idea to send your robotic doppelganger out for a bit to mingle, just to assure the public that everything is just peachy down here.
A crusty red demon, about the size of a Chucky doll and adorned with all the stereotypical trappings of a bad Krampus rendering lands by your feet. This seems oddly familiar, though the much of your recent memory is a fragmented jumble.

"A deal! A deal!" it squeals in delight. "A piece of every part of you, in exchange for your machine's transcendence! Yes, yes!"

Mother warned to never trust devils, though you are fairly sure she was referring to your dad, for whom you could say the same about. The imp taps its fiery foot impatiently.
A thick red gel oozes up from a thousand nascent micro-cracks in your floor, coalescing into an amorphously billowy, corpulent mass of undulating flesh. This seems oddly familiar, though the much of your recent memory is a fragmented jumble.

"A deal!" it bellows through a thick, lispy phlegm. "A limitless thing, for a piece of your most beloved! Choose!"
Despite an abundance of cautionary measures, including the sacrifice of several neighborhood strays, your Sterile-B-Good virus detector has picked up - you guessed it- a virus. This particular one threatens to eat away at %1$s. It will require a substantial investment of resources to eradicate it.
"Hey, %1$s!\ Yeah, I'm talking to you!"

Your %2$s has apparently gained the power of linguistic communication.

"I'm bored, cranky, and I don't particularly like you. Sing me a song or I'm gonna cause some trouble before going mute again for a while."

Well, you heard the thing. A genie appears! Apparently you were rubbing what you thought was something else, but was in fact a magic bottle.

"Lo, mortal! I am a beneficent spirit, and I will heal a part of your device. Which will it be?

Well, aren't we a lucky one today! A genie appears! Apparently you were rubbing what you thought was something else, but was in fact a magic bottle.

"Lo, mortal! I am not one of those goodie two-shoes, humanitarian spirits. For disturbing my repose, I will damage a part of your machine. Choose!"

Ah, nuts. Sometimes, you really loathe yourself. This moment is one of those times. You have an irresistible urge to watch two of your machine's components battle each other for your amusement.

You realize this is terribly detrimental to your life, legacy, and likely freedom, but there is almost certainly no resisting the compulsion. Your late night virtual reality %1$s sessions have drawn a critical mass of power away from your machine! It looks like the %2$s will be damaged shortly, though you can flood it with extra power at the expense of another component, if you wish. This is how science works, folks. The ancient Indian burial ground your laboratory is built on bubbles up like an ethereal volcano, releasing the spirits of exploited indigenous persons into your lair. This happens every so often, unfortunately.

You know they will not leave without sacrificing at least some of your machine to atone for centuries of war crimes. They have narrowed it down to the %1$s or the %2$s, so which will it be? High stakes %1$s is the newest rage among compulsive online gamblers, and you have a free moment to spare. Would you like to try your luck?
With all of your machine components upgraded to their present capacity, there is the opportunity for a majestic ascension or a shameful fall from grace. Again, this is how science works.

You may choose as many or as few components as you would like. Do tread lightly when playing this close to the sun though, yeah? You throw your machine's fate into the grasping hands of the gods… You decide not to risk any of your machine's components. The Strength Infuser has %1$s.

The Dexterity Animator has %2$s.

The Intelligence Designer has %3$s.

The Beauty Sculptor has %4$s.

The Loyalty Inculcator has %5$s.
Your hands and feet jump into a whirlwind of flurry. Switches are felled and raised, knobs are turned, and levers are cranked. When dusk at last falls, you breathe a sigh of tearful, dissatisfied satisfaction as the %1$s takes damage instead. Sometimes, one must simply accept his or her fate without interference. You choke a silent sob as the %1$s, as much your child as any flesh and blood could be, hurts for the worse. They say the greatest tragedy is when a parent outlives his child, which is why you decided to invest in the human extermination trade instead. Still, as the %1$s crumbles before your eyes, you kind of sort of get what they mean.
Between beatings, mother often told you to carry your head high, suffer no shame, and live your life to its fullest potential. Well gosh darn it, if only her bludgeoned remains underneath your floor could see you now.

Not content to allow harm to visit your life's work just for a bit of anonymity, you divert the excess energy. The resulting cacophonous clamor is severe indeed, and there is little doubt that anyone within an uncomfortable radius heard it loud and clear. Not content to advertise yourself to the world just yet, you allow the %1$s to sacrifice itself for the greater good. There will be no medals, no parades, no Lifetime original movies starring %2$s and %3$s as the machine and you, but a quiet nobility rests here nonetheless. Do all heroes wear capes? You don't know, having neither seen nor heard a spit of television, cinema, radio, or podcast in the past decade. What you do know is that for someone who is technically more formaldehyde and methamphetamine than man, you have managed to retrieve your pills without consequence. Huzzah. The good news is that your lifeblood (mind the misnomer, for naught but sickly sweet oil, liquor, and preservative have flowed through your veins for the past decade) has been retrieved. The bad news? Well, you knew it was coming. The process was not kind to the %1$s, which has taken damage. Where is the emoji for crumbling old mad scientist? Is this some Apple ageist huffle buffle? You make a mental note to write a letter to Steve Jobs. Is it still Steve Jobs? You need to get out more.

Unfortunately, without your pills your body continues to wither away. The choice is made. The damage is done. The life of the person that is you goes on. My gods, brave one! Who knows how the universe turns with such fearless, delusional resolve! Whatever angelic or demonic power heard you, heard you well. The inevitable damage has been averted, and you grow stronger in the knowledge that sometimes the uncontrollable can be controlled. What did you think would happen with this gambit, man-child? Alas, the apparent expectation of screaming helplessly into an indifferent universal void versus its reality has cost you a bit of your own mind. Fortune has truly smiled upon you on this blessed and most holy of days. You managed to pluck just the right amount of stuff from each constituent part, leaving them either none the wiser or not quite wanting enough to suffer ill effects. A little bit from you, a smidgen from you, and…oh, dear.

Even in its rudimentary sentience, the %1$s notices you plucking away at its most valuable innards - really, the only thing it owns - and is more than a little miffed. It was already running in overdrive to cope with the missing parts, and decides to simply stop trying so hard.
